alert.note: Alert for St. Louis (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 14 at 6:20PM CDT until May 14 at 9:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of east central Missouri, including the following county, Saint Louis. * WHEN...Until 930 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 619 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Rain rates of 2 to 4 inches per hour have been observed with these storms. - Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Chesterfield, Wildwood, Ballwin, Kirkwood, Webster Groves, Manchester, Creve Coeur, Clayton, Crestwood, Town and Country, Eureka, Ellisville, Richmond Heights, Ladue, Sunset Hills, Des Peres, Brentwood, Maplewood, Valley Park and Shrewsbury.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
